subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|あめ|yomi=k}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|雨|tr=same||rain}}. Found both alone and in compounds. Perhaps derived from {{IPAchar|/same/}} → {{IPAchar|/ame/}} with loss of the initial {{IPAchar|/s/}}; see ''same'' reading below for more.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|さめ|yomi=k}}
Cognate with {{m|ja|雨|tr=ame||rain}}.

Appears as the latter part in older compounds with an ''-s-'' infix or prefix. It is unclear if this leading {{IPAchar|/s/}} is indicative of an earlier form (''same''), or if this was an {{w|epenthesis}} for [[euphony]] to avoid vowel clusters, or for other reasons. This {{IPAchar|/s/}} is also seen in {{m|ja|青|tr=ao|pos=becoming ''sao'' in old compounds}} and {{m|ja|稲|tr=ine|pos=becoming ''shine'' in old compounds}}.

Given that this {{IPAchar|/s/}} only ever appears interstitially, and given the semantics, this {{IPAchar|/s/}} may be cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} interfix {{m|ko|ᄉ|-ᄉ-|tr=-s-}} used to mark possession, much like {{cog|en|'s}}.
